Authors: Stephen W. Peterson, Samantha S. Orchard, Suresh Menon
Title:
Penicillium menonorum, a new species related to P.
pimiteouiense
Abstract:
Penicillium menonorum is described as a new
monoverticillate, non-vesiculate species that resembles P. restrictum
and P. pimiteouiense. On the basis of phylogenetic analysis of DNA
sequences from four loci, P. menonorum occurs in a clade with P.
pimiteouiense, P. vinaceum, P. guttulosum, E. rubidurum and E. parvum.
Genealogical concordance analysis was applied to P. pimiteouiense and E.
parvum, substantiating the phenotypically defined species. The species
P. rubidurum, P. guttulosum and P. menonorum were on distinct branches
statistically excluded from inclusion in other species and have distinct
phenotypes.
